Package domain

Class Grafo

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.Grafo
  • public class Grafo
extends java.lang.Object
    The Grafo class represents an undirected weighted graph. It provides methods for adding nodes and edges, checking connectivity between nodes, and finding the shortest path between two nodes using Dijkstra's algorithm. This class implements the Serializable interface, allowing instances to be serialized and deserialized.
    Since:
    2024-05-25

        public boolean isConnected​(int nodoA,
                           int nodoB)
        Checks if there is a path between two nodes in the graph.

        nodoA - the id of the first node
        nodoB - the id of the second node
        Returns:

      • shortestWay

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> shortestWay​(int nodoA,
                                                     int nodoB)
                                              throws QuoriPOOBException
        Finds the shortest path between two nodes in the graph using Dijkstra's algorithm.
        Parameters:
        nodoA - the id of the starting node
        nodoB - the id of the destination node
        Returns:
        a list of node ids representing the shortest path
        Throws:
        QuoriPOOBException - if there is no path between the nodes
